strings.washImageOneCaption: Cleaned latrines made by timber and plastic in an IDP camp
strings.washImageTwoCaption: Elevated latrines set up in an IDP camp
strings.washImageThreeCaption: Latrines built timber and plastic sheets
strings.washImageFiveCaption: Population looking at hygiene promotion material
strings.washImageSixCaption: RCRC personnel maintaining set up latrines
strings.washImageSevenCaption: RCRC personnel performing hygiene promotion activities with the community
strings.capacityOne: Sanitation facilities and hygiene promotion for 20,000 people for a maximum of 4 months according to ERU SOPs.
strings.washCapacityTextOne: Provide support in wash response operations through the IFRC shelter roster of trained professionals and partner National Societies.
strings.emergencyServicesSectionOne: Hygiene promotion (including community mobilization, hygiene education, and operation and maintenance).
strings.emergencyServicesSectionTwo: Basic sanitation facilities (including latrines, vector control and solid waste disposal) for up to 20,000).
strings.designedForItemOne: Situations where bad hygiene is consistently practiced by affected people, where there is the danger of diarrhoea, cholera, and other disease outbreaks will persist.
strings.personnelCompositionValue: Team Leader, 1-2 Sanitation Engineer, 1 Hygiene promoter, 1 Logistic/Admin/Finance.
strings.personnelDetail: In addition to the above team, local staff is normally contracted to assist in the construction of the sanitation facilities (masons, builders supervisors, etc).
